Articles.Content: When I first started playing KSP I thought it would be cool to have a floating 'Space City' orbiting the sun. I have not had a successful launch except P.S.S. (Put Satellite around Sun). Anyway I wanted to put this here so you can post your space cities, and if you don\'t have one, try and make one! You must have 0.14 x4 if you want your city to stay around the sun. Below is P.S.S.
That picture has Buzz Kerman! :D
I got another one up except this time its bigger!
I had a Buzz Kermin, he was killed when a premature fairing panel separation ,during launch, took out several boosters. :\'(
Oh come on NOBODY has ANYTHING!? Try making something maybe......

I\'ve actually been working on getting a city of sorts into orbit, but it\'s still in the experimental phase. No weapons attached as of yet but there are plans to deck it out.

Mixed results in getting it to be stable, the arms tend to snap off at the base. The number of struts involved is started to slow down fps considerably.

Lolwut

How did you get that off the ground ?
Might have had some help from instant orbit. Keep trying to get a picture of it near the pad for comparison, so far the best I\'ve gotten is this.

HOLY CRAP! That there is a lot of habitation!

My biggest sky city was this:

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=5767.0

Structural stability and vibration is always the biggest obstacle, at least for me. Anyone can put together the raw lifting power, but keeping the payload from tearing itself apart is . . . tricky.

the arms tend to snap off at the base.

consider it as a kind of defensive debris minefield

HOLY CRAP! That there is a lot of habitation!

It currently has 244 2m habitation modules. Hope to finally get it in orbit in one piece once I get 0.14.
